author: @welt
title: Wechselhaft mit Schauern und Gewittern - Unwetter möglich - WELT
text:
Ein launisches Tiefdruckgebiet bringt Schauer und teils kräftige Gewitter nach Niedersachsen. Lokal ist Starkregen mit Unwettergefahr möglich.
Anzeige In Niedersachsen bleibt das Wetter in den kommenden Tagen wechselhaft und teils ungemütlich. Wie der Deutsche Wetterdienst (DWD) mitteilt, bleibt es bereits am Donnerstag wechselnd bewölkt. Vor allem im Nordosten kann es zu Schauern und vereinzelten, teils kräftigen Gewittern kommen. Örtlich besteht Unwettergefahr durch heftigen Starkregen. Die Höchstwerte liegen zwischen 20 und 23 Grad, auf den Inseln werden etwa 20 Grad erwartet. Der Wind wehr schwach bis mäßig, an der Küste teilweise frisch.
Nächtliche Schauer möglich In der Nacht zum Freitag ist es wechselnd bis stark bewölkt, vor allem im Osten kann es noch vereinzelt Schauer geben. Die Temperaturen sinken auf etwa 15 Grad, auf den Inseln bleiben sie bei rund 17 Grad bei schwachem Wind.
Anzeige Am Freitag setzt sich das wechselhafte Wetter fort. Besonders im Nordosten sind einzelne Schauer möglich. Die Temperaturen steigen auf 23 bis 25 Grad, auf den Inseln nur bis 21 Grad. Der Wind bleibt schwach bis mäßig. In der Nacht klingen die Schauer langsam ab. Es ist meist gering bewölkt oder klar, örtlich bildet sich Nebel. Die Tiefstwerte liegen zwischen 14 und 18 Grad.
Samstag: Sonne und Gewitter am Abend Das Wochenende beginnt zunächst aufgelockert bewölkt. Am Samstagabend ziehen im Südwesten dichte Wolken mit Schauern und Gewittern auf. Laut DWD steigen die Temperaturen deutlich an und erreichen im Binnenland bis zu 30 Grad, auf den Inseln bleibt es mit 21 Grad kühler. Der Wind kommt schwach bis mäßig.
Auch am Sonntag ist mit weiteren Schauern und Gewittern zu rechnen. Die Höchsttemperaturen erreichen 27 Grad im Binnenland und etwa 22 Grad an der Küste.
dpa-infocom GmbH

author: Clément Poursain
title: Dragon 12: le «cerf-volant» énergétique sous-marin révolutionnaire entre en action
text: Temps de lecture: 2 minutes - Repéré sur [The Next Web](https://thenextweb.com/news/worlds-biggest-tidal-energy-kite-faroe-islands) La start-up suédoise Minesto s'est donnée une mission: générer de l'électricité grâce aux courants océaniques, de manière renouvelable et abordable. L'installation de son produit phare au large des îles Féroé montre que l'entreprise scandinave est sur la bonne voie et pourrait redéfinir notre manière de tirer profit de l'énergie hydraulique marine. [Le Dragon 12](https://minesto.com/products/kite-systems/dragon-12/), c'est son nom, est une sorte de gigantesque raie manta jaune (Minesto préfère la dénomination de «kite» ou «cerf-volant»). Cette hydrolienne «cerf-volant» marémotrice (qui utilise la force des marées) est équipée d'un rotor. Une fois immergé à contre-courant, celui-ci permet de générer assez d'électricité pour alimenter une petite ville de 1.000 foyers, [indique le site néerlandais d'actualité technologique The Next Web](https://thenextweb.com/news/worlds-biggest-tidal-energy-kite-faroe-islands). À l'origine conçu par le constructeur automobile Saab, le projet a volé de ses propres ailes avec Minesto, qui le peaufine (et le commercialise) depuis 2007. Martin Edlund, le PDG de la start-up suédoise, se réjouit de cette toute première installation aux résultats plus que convaincants: «C'est un grand jour pour Minesto. Nous avons atteint l'étape la plus significative de l'histoire de l'entreprise en produisant de l'électricité sur le réseau avec notre centrale électrique à l'échelle du mégawatt.» Malgré son énorme potentiel, la force du courant et des marées n'est pour l'instant que très peu exploitée. En cause, le coût et la taille des hydroliennes existantes, qui ne facilitent ni leur développement ni leur installation. O2, [la première turbine marémotrice connectée au réseau](https://korii.slate.fr/tech/energies-renouvelables-mini-centrale-turbine-maremotrice-maree-orbital-o2) et produite par la start-up écossaise [Orbital Marine Power](https://www.orbitalmarine.com/o2/), mesure 72 mètres de long et pèse 680 tonnes. En comparaison, le Dragon 12 mesure 12 mètres de diamètre et pèse 28 tonnes. Sidérant quand on sait qu'O2 ne produit «que» 2 mégawatts, contre 1,2 mégawatt pour son concurrent suédois. Le Grand Jaune L'efficacité de l'outil de Minesto s'explique par son fonctionnement inédit. Le Dragon 12 n'est pas une [hydrolienne](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydrolienne) statique, mais glisse dans les courants en s'éloignant de la surface et en remontant. Un mouvement en forme de «huit» qui permet d'amplifier le flux d'eau passant dans son rotor et donc de générer plus d'électricité que ce que produirait une turbine hydraulique fixe installée au même endroit. Face à ce premier succès, Minesto voit grand. La start-up basée à Göteborg (sud-ouest de la Suède) envisage de produire une centaine de ses «cerfs-volants» marémoteurs, destinés à fournir à l'archipel féroïen 40% de ses besoins en électricité. L'Union européenne (UE) a bien senti l'intérêt d'une telle technologie. Avec plus de 40 millions d'euros de financement du Fonds européen de développement régional, Minesto affirme être en tête des investissements de l'UE dans le secteur de l'énergie marine.

author: time news
title: 23-year-old Man Arrested in Turkey Extradited to Sweden for Attempted Murder and Kidnapping – Aftonbladet Update
text:
23-Year-Old Man Arrested in Turkey and Extradited to Sweden for Attempted Murder and Kidnapping
A 23-year-old man has been arrested in Turkey and is set to be extradited to Sweden in connection with an attempted murder and a kidnapping in Sundsvall earlier this year. According to information obtained by Aftonbladet, the man, who was detained in his absence, will be returning to Sweden to face charges.
The man is suspected of beating and stabbing three boys along with several other people. Two of the boys are said to have traveled to Sundsvall with the intention of carrying out a murder, while the third boy joined them in Sundsvall and was also subjected to a beating. The boys had reportedly planned the murder, but their plans were leaked, leading to their kidnapping and a brutal assault in a forest area.
They were eventually found on a staircase outside a residential building where they sought help and received medical care. The boys survived the attack but sustained serious injuries and had to be sedated and treated.
The attempted murder is believed to be connected to a conflict over the drug trade in Sundsvall between the Foxtrot and Dalen networks. Parts of the beating were filmed and shared on social media, with the video aiming to mock and belittle the Foxtrot network.
The 23-year-old was arrested in his absence in September, suspected of attempted murder and kidnapping. He is also known to have a prior conviction for breaking the Knife Act and minor drug offenses.
According to Aftonbladet’s information, the man will be extradited from Turkey to Sweden on Friday to face the pending charges.

author: Reinette LeJeune
title: Aqara HomeKit smart lock U100 with fingerprint sensor and Apple Home key returns to $133 low
text:
Aqara Smart Lock U100 for $132.99 shipped . Down from its $230 price tag, it has only seen a few previous discounts since its release back during the summer, with Black Friday sales dropping costs down to the lowest prices we have tracked. Today’s deal comes in as a 42% markdown off the going rate, giving you $97 in savings ($7 more than our previous mention) and marking a return to the all-time low from Thanksgiving weekend sales. Over the summer, we were quite impressed with this new smart lock, which you can read about in our hands-on review , or head below the fold to learn more.
The U100 smart lock comes fully integrated into Apple Home, sporting a touchscreen keypad and fingerprint sensor that allows for easier access to your home. It also offers access via Apple Home keys by simply tapping your iPhone or Apple Watch to the door – even when it’s out of power. The high-precision fingerprint sensor is able to save up to 50 different fingerprints and numeral passwords are easily reconfigured through the Aqara Home app, even allowing for one-time passwords for visitors, as well as a mechanical key for emergencies. It features an auto-lock function that utilizes the built-in gyroscope to lock the door anytime immediately after closing it, as well as a “do not disturb” mode to silence its actions for when you return home late. It also comes fully compatible with third-party ecosystems like Google Home, Alexa, and IFTTT.
If you’ve wanted more atmospheric lighting in your home, check out our recent coverage of the Govee Smart Light Bulb 2-pack that is currently on sale at its lowest price we have tracked. They offer the usual smart features like scheduling, timers, group controls, music syncing, and RGBWW action that gives you 16 million DIY colors and 54 pre-set scene modes. You can also head on over to our smart home hub to stay up-to-date on the very best deals on all the gear and gadgets that are sure to bring your home further into the twenty-first century.
Aqara Smart Lock U100 features: 【Fingerprint and More Ways to Unlock】The Smart Lock U100 offers multiple ways to unlock, including a high-precision fingerprint reader for up to 50 fingerprints, remotely configurable passwords via the Aqara Home app (An Aqara Zigbee 3.0 hub is required), one-time local passwords for visitors, and a mechanical key for emergency use. * The NFC card is not included and is sold separately. 【Automations with Aqara and Third-Party Devices】With an Aqara Zigbee 3.0 hub, the Smart Door Lock U100 is compatible with third-party ecosystems like Google Home, Alexa, IFTTT as well as the Aqara Home app, allowing it to be easily integrated into a wide range of smart home setups and used in smart home automations. For example, when someone presses the Aqara Video Doorbell G4, you will be able to view who is at your door and easily unlock the U100. 【A Durable and Secure Biometric door Lock with Long Battery Life】 The U100 is powered by 4 AA 1.5V batteries (included) and has a long battery life of up to 8 months. Also, a USB-C port for emergency charging is available. The lock body made of zinc alloy has an IP65 rating and complies with the same safety standard as BHMA Level 3. It’s capable of withstanding temperatures ranging from -31°F to 151°F. Your sensitive data (e.g., fingerprints) is stored locally and fully AES encrypted.

author: Zach Jewell
title: Trump Outlines Stark Contrast With Biden On Middle East Policy, Says Iran Got Rich ‘Because Joe Biden Allowed Them To’ | The Daily Wire
text: Streaming Now The decade's most triggering comedy Former President Donald Trump laid out his foreign policy differences with President Joe Biden Wednesday, blasting his political rival for allowing Iran to “get rich” under his watch. Trump spoke with [Just the News](https://justthenews.com/politics-policy/all-things-trump/newsmaker-interview-trump-puts-iran-europeans-and-antisemites) in a wide-ranging interview that touched on the increasingly unstable Middle East and Iran’s involvement with terrorist groups such as Hezbollah and Hamas. During his interview, Trump focused on his foreign policy record, saying that Biden’s strategy has created chaos in the Middle East and put the U.S. in an undesirable position. “Iran was allowed to get rich because Joe Biden allowed them to,” Trump said. “So he could say whatever he wants. But he’s the reason for this. He’s an incompetent president. He’s a compromised president, totally compromised. But he allowed them to get rich.” “But worse than being rich, because of the money, because of what they have, they will have within a short period of time nuclear weapons. And that is never something that can be allowed to happen,” Trump added. Under the Trump administration, the U.S. pulled out of the Iran Nuclear Deal, which [gave](https://www.wsj.com/articles/iran-nuclear-deal-explained-11610564572) Iran access to over $100 billion in oil revenues that were previously frozen by U.S. sanctions. Trump had sought to restrict Iran’s missile program and push the Tehran regime to sever its ties to terrorism, but Iran refused to negotiate. Shortly after Biden won back the White House for Democrats, however, the administration began working out a new Iran Nuclear Deal. Iran backs terrorist groups such as Hamas and the Houthis, which are actively warring against Israel. The Houthis have also recently targeted ships in the Middle East, and the U.S. has [shot down](https://www.timesofisrael.com/witnesses-report-2-explosions-off-sinai-coast-strange-object-falling-into-water/) at least 12 drones and five missiles launched by the terrorist group. Earlier this week, Iran appeared to [claim responsibility](https://www.dailywire.com/news/iran-and-hamas-feud-over-what-fueled-oct-7-massacre-of-israelis) for Hamas’ October 7 attack on Israel, during which terrorists brutally murdered at least 1,200 people. The Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps reportedly said the terrorist attack on Israel was a response to the assassination of top Iranian General Qassem Soleimani by the U.S. in 2020, which was carried out under the orders of Trump. “Iran was broke. They didn’t have any money to get around. I put sanctions on. I put everything on, and told countries, China, many countries, India, France, ‘don’t buy oil … you buy any oil, we’re not going to do business with you. And we’re going to put tariffs on all the products that do get through, We’re not going to do business,’” said Trump, the frontrunner in the Republican presidential primary. [CLICK HERE TO GET THE DAILYWIRE+ APP](https://onelink.to/dwapp) “They didn’t have money for Hezbollah,” he continued. “And this would have never happened, it also wouldn’t have happened because they knew the consequences would have been much different than what you see right now.”

author: Richard Ashmore
title: UK snow: Map shows entire nation engulfed by winter storm and battered by gale force winds | Weather | News | Express.co.uk
text:
Maps on Saturday December 30 show snow and rain covering much of the country (Image: WXCharts ) Britain could be celebrating the New Year with a cocktail of rain, snow and gale-force winds as weather maps show a huge storm system barreling into the nation.
A large low-pressure band from the Atlantic could be the last named storm of 2023 as it brings winds of up to 70 or 80 mph in places.
It will mean no respite for parts of the country that have already suffered damage from Storm Gerrit, which sparked a tornado in Greater Manchester this week.
Maps from WXCharts for Saturday, December 30 show a vast swirling maelstrom of low pressure the size of Britain and Ireland heading for these shores.
READ MORE... BBC Breakfast's Carol Kirkwood marries partner Steve at intimate wedding
On Saturday high winds reaching 70 to 80 mph could cause disruption and damage (Image: WXCharts ) Wind charts for tomorrow show an enormous arm of red covering much of the country, marking gale force gusts of up to 80mph in exposed parts and on high ground.
The Met Office has issued yellow weather warnings for large parts of southern England, Northern Ireland and Wales starting from 11am on Saturday.
As well as blustery conditions, the weather maps also show parts of the Highlands of Scotland could see snow, and England and Wales might see heavy prolonged rain.
Met Office chief forecaster Steven Ramsdale said the new system of weather would likely affect the same places as Storm Gerrit.
He said: "This system is likely to bring a range of weather including hill snow.
"Heavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.”
Don't miss...
Israeli hostage Mia Schem, 21, 'left screaming' after vet operated on her [SPOTLIGHT ]
Prince Harry’s emotional speech that brought Princess Kate to 'tears' [REVEAL ]
Watch moment firefighters rescue driver dangerously dangling over busy road [REPORT ]
Wet weather could mark the end of 2023 with heavy showers, especially in the north and west (Image: WXCharts )
 Stephen Dixon, from the Met Office said after the New Year it was likely windy conditions would carry on with the added possibility of "wintry hazards".
He said: "Although there’s uncertainty talking at this range, early January is likely to start with a continuation of some breezy conditions, with showers likely in places.
"Further periods of unsettled weather are likely, with the possibility of some wintry hazards in the north at times, though it’s too early to provide any details. With low pressure largely in charge, some periods of heavy rain are also likely."
Trending Five-day Met Office forecast
Today:
Blustery showers, heavy at times, with snow in the north. Mild in the south with colder conditions across the north.
Tonight:
Showers dying out overnight, with more persistent rain in the far north of Scotland. Winds easing and turning colder for all with a frost in the north.
Saturday:
Increasingly unsettled with strong winds and heavy rain pushing northeastwards, turning to hill snow for northern parts.
Outlook for Sunday to Tuesday:
Remaining changeable, with blustery showers continuing Sunday and some sunny spells. Showers likely easing for most on New Year's Day. Turning cloudier in the southwest with rain on Tuesday.

author: Empresa Peruana de Servicios Editoriales S. A. EDITORA PERÚ
title: MINJUSDH expresa preocupación por eliminación de norma de extinción de dominio | Noticias | Agencia Peruana de Noticias Andina
text:
El Ministerio de Justicia y Derechos Humanos (MINJUSDH) manifestó que la eliminación de la norma sobre extinción de dominio sería un grave retroceso en la lucha contra la criminalidad y delitos graves, en relación con la demanda de inconstitucionalidad presentada por el Defensor del Pueblo, José Gutiérrez, el pasado 2 de agosto.
?? #Comunicado | Sobre la eliminación de norma sobre Extinción de Dominio, el MINJUSDH expresa lo siguiente: pic.twitter.com/gKEpg5ENgT
— Ministerio de Justicia y Derechos Humanos (@MinjusDH_Peru) August 8, 2024
La institución expresó su preocupación por la demanda presentada por la Defensoría del Pueblo contra el Decreto Legislativo sobre extinción de dominio e hizo un llamado a la reflexión para que el mencionado organismo constitucional vele preferentemente por los derechos de la ciudadanía sobre otros intereses evidenciados en la objeción sobre la viabilidad de esta importante figura.
Asimismo, el Ministerio de Justicia indicó que esta demanda tendría incidencia directa contra las entidades beneficiarias como el Poder Judicial, Policía Nacional del Perú y Procuradurías Públicas , quienes son parte del Subsistema de Extinción de Dominio.
Agregó, también, que afectaría la operatividad del Programa Nacional de Bienes Incautados (PRONABI), adscrito al MINJUSDH, en la lucha contra la criminalidad y delitos graves que ellos desarrollan.
[Lea también: Congreso: Junta de Portavoces sesiona mañana viernes 9 de agosto ]
Los procesos de extinción de dominio permitieron recuperar, a favor del Estado peruano, más de S/ 250 millones de soles en activos, bienes o ganancias producto de actividades ilícitas vinculadas con el crimen organizado , que tienen como fin obtener beneficios económicos y explotar mercados ilegales, indicó el Organismo de Justicia.
“Exhortamos al Defensor del Pueblo que en el ejercicio de sus funciones priorice y defienda los intereses de la ciudadanía, ya que la eliminación de la extinción de dominio afectaría todo lo avanzado en el marco de la lucha contra la criminalidad y delitos graves” , añadió el departamento de justicia.
Por último, apuntó que confían en la labor ponderada del Tribunal Constitucional para la interpretación de la Constitución en beneficio de todos los peruanos.
(FIN) OPG/RMCH
Más en Andina: ?? Con el propósito de hacer frente al crimen organizado y delitos conexos al sector de construcción civil, el @MTPE_Peru y el @MininterPeru firmaron un convenio de cooperación interinstitucional que les permite unir esfuerzos.
?? https://t.co/fKI129vGYW pic.twitter.com/CrncuelLb8
— Agencia Andina (@Agencia_Andina) August 8, 2024

author: vinetur.com
title: Non-alcoholic spirits surge in the US, outpacing other alternatives
text:
2025-01-23
Non-alcoholic spirits are rapidly growing in the United States, positioning themselves as the fastest-expanding segment within the broader spirits category. According to IWSR US Navigator data, the market has recorded an annual compound growth rate exceeding 60% over the past five years, far outpacing other non-alcoholic alternatives like beer and wine, although its overall volume remains smaller.
The rise of these products is attributed to factors such as increased interest in healthy lifestyles, the influence of movements like "sober-curious," and improvements in the quality and taste of the beverages. Koryn Ternes, consulting manager for the Americas at IWSR, notes that the segment's premium positioning and shifts in social norms have allowed non-alcoholic spirits to gain market traction, offering sophisticated and stigma-free alternatives.
Consumption of these beverages is highly seasonal, with January marking the highest sales volume. This trend is driven by New Year's resolutions, the popularity of "Dry January," and post-holiday habit changes, doubling the average sales seen during other months. Spring, particularly April and May, also sees an increase, fueled by outdoor celebrations and holidays like Easter, Mother's Day, and Memorial Day. In contrast, summer and fall witness a decline in consumption, reflecting a shift in preference toward other beverage categories.
Regionally, coastal states lead the market. California and New York accounted for more than one-third of the total volume of non-alcoholic spirits in 2023, with annual growth rates of 47% and 44%, respectively, over the past five years. The diversity of their populations and urban lifestyles have been key drivers in the adoption and evolution of these products.
Smaller states such as Rhode Island, Delaware, and Vermont stand out for their high demand relative to their size, as indicated by the Consumer Demand Index (CDI). Rhode Island leads the index nationally, presenting an opportunity for targeted marketing campaigns and localized expansion strategies.
In contrast, larger states like Texas and Florida underperform in this segment despite their significant populations. Texas ranks among the bottom five on the demand index, highlighting the need for strategic efforts to increase product awareness and availability. Educational campaigns and the introduction of premium offerings could play a pivotal role in fostering growth in these areas. Washington, D.C., emerges as another important market, ranking second on the index. Its young, urban population makes it a model for promoting these beverages in other metropolitan areas.
The growth of non-alcoholic spirits reflects a shift in consumption trends toward more inclusive and wellness-aligned products. By focusing strategically on peak consumption months and balancing efforts between established and emerging markets, this category shows strong potential in the U.S. market.
Founded in 2007, Vinetur® is a registered trademark of VGSC S.L. with a long history in the wine industry.
